meanings.sent1: The overprotected child was never allowed to play outside without supervision.
meanings.sent2: The puppy looked sad because it was overprotected and never got to explore the yard freely.
meanings.sent3: The overprotected phone case was so thick that it made the phone hard to fit in a pocket.
meanings.sent4: The delicate flower wilted under the overprotected greenhouse conditions.
meanings.sent5: The overprotected computer system had so many security measures that it was difficult to access for regular users.

meanings.definition: To protect too much or excessively.
meanings.sent1: The worried mother tended to overprotect her children, not letting them out of her sight.
meanings.sent2: The guard dog tended to overprotect the house, barking at any unfamiliar noise.
meanings.sent3: The knight's squire joked that he would overprotect the castle by wrapping it in bubble wrap.
meanings.sent4: The overprotective mother hen clucked loudly whenever anyone came near her chicks.
meanings.sent5: The overprotecting software constantly monitored every action on the computer, making it hard to use for regular tasks.
